page.title: 02FARMING_ COL. JENKINS FARM
page.content: There are 640 acres on this mainly arable farm, 596 of these are farm acres. 107 are permanent pasture. The sheep (146 acres) are his own breed, basically Cambridge cross Freisian, 24 sucklers, 6 heifers in calf and 24 calves at about 1 year old. There are also 30 acres of woodland, 185 acres of winter wheat, 201 acres of winter barley and 98 acres of spring barley, making a total of 484 acres of cereal crop. Last year 36 tons of the grain produced was for fodder, the rest was sold. A lot of modern machinery is used on the farm. There are 5 cottages, 3 of which are lived in, with 4-5 staff. Colonel Jenkins has farmed for 28 years and enjoys it, but does not know what the farming future will bring.
